Key Match Events: Bradley Beal scored 25 points, Kevin Durant added 23, and the Phoenix Suns beat the Atlanta Hawks 123-115 on Thursday night.
Bradley Beal made a driving layup just before the third quarter buzzer to give the Suns a 98-92 lead heading into the fourth.
Grayson Allen hit his fifth 3-pointer to give the Suns a 120-105 lead with 3:26 left.
Allen sealed it with a tough layup in traffic with 36 seconds left.
Post-Match Reflections: The Suns have won two of its past three as it tries to shake a slump that's lasted nearly two months.
The Suns have a lot of work to do, but now that their Big 3 are healthy, they have a chance to gain some momentum.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Suns took a 38-31 lead in the first quarter after shooting 75% from the field.
The Hawks rallied with their own hot-shooting quarter to take a 72-68 advantage by halftime.
The Suns shot 57.6% from the field.
Others: Atlanta falls back to.500 for the season after struggling to stop the Suns' offense.
The Hawks — who have dropped four of their last five games — missed forward Jalen Johnson, who missed a third straight game with right shoulder inflammation.
